response:
Priority is a right parasagittal cortical process causing contralateral leg-predominant pyramidal signs; neuropathy aetiologies explain distal sensory loss and Romberg. Compressive myelopathy is an important alternate single-lesion mimic.

differential_diagnosis = ["Right parasagittal meningioma", "Right anterior cerebral artery territory infarct (subacute)", "Multiple sclerosis with focal cortical/juxtacortical plaque", "Right parasagittal glioma", "Cervical spondylotic myelopathy", "Length\u2011dependent axonal polyneuropathy due to diabetes", "Vitamin B12 deficiency\u2013related myeloneuropathy/neuropathy", "Alcohol-related neuropathy", "Hypothyroid neuropathy", "Paraproteinaemic neuropathy (MGUS/amyloid)"]
